## Example Usage

{{< chooser language "typescript,python,go,csharp" / >}}
### Create a secret
{{% example csharp %}}
```csharp
using Pulumi;
using AzureNextGen = Pulumi.AzureNextGen;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var secret = new AzureNextGen.KeyVault.Latest.Secret("secret", new AzureNextGen.KeyVault.Latest.SecretArgs
        {
            Properties = new AzureNextGen.KeyVault.Latest.Inputs.SecretPropertiesArgs
            {
                Value = "secret-value",
            },
            ResourceGroupName = "sample-group",
            SecretName = "secret-name",
            VaultName = "sample-vault",
        });
    }

}

```

{{% /example %}}

{{% example go %}}

```go
package main

import (
	keyvault "github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure-nextgen/sdk/go/azure/keyvault/latest"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v2/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := keyvault.NewSecret(ctx, "secret", &keyvault.SecretArgs{
			Properties: &keyvault.SecretPropertiesArgs{
				Value: pulumi.String("secret-value"),
			},
			ResourceGroupName: pulumi.String("sample-group"),
			SecretName:        pulumi.String("secret-name"),
			VaultName:         pulumi.String("sample-vault"),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}

```

{{% /example %}}

{{% example python %}}

```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_azure_nextgen as azure_nextgen

secret = azure_nextgen.keyvault.latest.Secret("secret",
    properties=azure_nextgen.keyvault.latest.SecretPropertiesArgs(
        value="secret-value",
    ),
    resource_group_name="sample-group",
    secret_name="secret-name",
    vault_name="sample-vault")

```

{{% /example %}}

{{% example typescript %}}

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as azure_nextgen from "@pulumi/azure-nextgen";

const secret = new azure_nextgen.keyvault.latest.Secret("secret", {
    properties: {
        value: "secret-value",
    },
    resourceGroupName: "sample-group",
    secretName: "secret-name",
    vaultName: "sample-vault",
});

```

        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Azure location of the key vault resource.{{% /md %}}</dd>
    <dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="name_python">
<a href="#name_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Name of the key vault resource.{{% /md %}}</dd>
    <dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="type_python">
<a href="#type_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">type</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Resource type of the key vault resource.{{% /md %}}</dd>
</dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

    <dt class="property-optional"

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#secretattributes">Pulumi.<wbr>Azure<wbr>Next<wbr>Gen.<wbr>Key<wbr>Vault.<wbr>Inputs.<wbr>Secret<wbr>Attributes<wbr>Args</a></span>

            title="Optional">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The value of the secret. NOTE: 'value' will never be returned from the service, as APIs using this model are is intended for internal use in ARM deployments. Users should use the data-plane REST service for interaction with vault secrets.{{% /md %}}</dd>
</dl>

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The content type of the secret.{{% /md %}}</dd>
    <dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="value_go">
<a href="#value_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The value of the secret. NOTE: 'value' will never be returned from the service, as APIs using this model are is intended for internal use in ARM deployments. Users should use the data-plane REST service for interaction with vault secrets.{{% /md %}}</dd>
</dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

## Import


An existing resource can be imported using its type token, name, and identifier, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import azure-nextgen:keyvault/latest:Secret secret-name /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/sample-group/providers/Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/sample-vault/secrets/secret-name 
```

	<dt>Repository</dt>
	<dd><a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure-nextgen">https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure-nextgen</a></dd>
	<dt>License</dt>
	<dd>Apache-2.0</dd>
</dl>
